alert.note: Alert for Cheshire; Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 3:27PM EST until January 05 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTRY PRECIPITATION TO MAKE FOR SLIPPERY TRAVEL TONIGHT AND THURSDAY... .Low pressure will move south of New England later today and tonight. It will initially start as rain except for in the mountains where snow and sleet is likely with some freezing rain possible. Eventually colder air works southward across the entire region tonight changing the precipitation to a mix of light snow, sleet, and freezing rain which should continue through at least Thursday morning allowing for slippery travel. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO NOON EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain and sleet expected. Total ice accumulations around a light glaze. * WHERE...Western and Central Hillsborough, Cheshire, Eastern Hillsborough, and Interior Rockingham Counties. * WHEN...From 5 AM to Noon EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible due to icy road conditions for the Thursday morning commute. These conditions may continue into the afternoon and evening commute as well.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org

area.areaDesc: Cheshire; Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Western And Central Hillsborough
